IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ENSURE EVERY AMERICAN HAS THE OPPORTUNITY TO LIVE IN DECENT HOUSING IN A SUITABLE NEIGHBORHOOD.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE NONPROFIT NATIONAL HOUSING CONFERENCE IS DEDICATED TO HELPING ENSURE SAFE, DECENT AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR ALL IN AMERICA. AS A DIVISION OF NHC, THE CENTER FOR HOUSING POLICY SPECIALIZES IN SOLUTIONS THROUGH RESEARCH, WORKING TO BROADEN UNDERSTANDING OF AMERICA'S AFFORDABLE HOUSING CHALLENGES AND EXAMINE THE IMPACT OF POLICIES AND PROGRAMS DEVELOPED TO ADDRESS THESE NEEDS. THROUGH EVIDENCE-BASED ADVOCACY FOR THE CONTINUUM OF HOUSING, NHC DEVELOPS IDEAS, RESOURCES AND POLICY SOLUTIONS TO SHAPE AN IMPROVED HOUSING LANDSCAPE.
IRS990.Desc: POLICY DEVELOPMENT: NHC WORKS WITH A BROAD COALITION OF HOUSING STAKEHOLDERS AND ADVOCATES AROUND A RANGE OF HOUSING ISSUES AND FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL. NHC HAS BEEN A LEADER AND PARTNER ON FAIR HOUSING ISSUES AND CONTINUED TO BE ENGAGED AROUND HUD'S AFFH RULE, PARTICIPATING IN A PEER-LEARNING GROUP AND ACTIVELY PROVIDING COMMENT AS HUD IMPLEMENTS AFFH. NHC CONVENES OVER 200 PARTICIPANTS IN ITS RESTORING NEIGHBORHOODS TASK FORCE, WHICH LIFTS UP RESEARCH, POLICY CHANGES AND BEST PRACTICES FOR COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT. IN 2015, NHC HELD A SOLUTIONS FOR RESTORING NEIGHBORHOODS CONVENING IN NEW ORLEANS WHICH DREW OVER 100 PARTICIPANTS. NHC ASSEMBLED A COALITION OF 7 HOUSING AND ENERGY GROUPS WORKING TO ADVANCE GREEN AFFORDABLE HOUSING AS PART OF CLEAN POWER PLAN IMPLEMENTATION. NHC ALSO BEGAN AN INCLUSIVE COMMUNITIES PEER LEARNING GROUP FOCUSED ON HELPING LOCALITIES BECOME MORE INCLUSIVE USING BEST PRACTICES IN HOUSING POLICY.NHC CONVENES WORKING GROUPS AROUND VETERAN'S HOUSING ACCESS, GREEN AFFORDABLE HOUSING, AND INTERNET CONNECTIVITY, TO ADVANCE POLICIES THAT IMPROVE ACCESS TO BROADBAND INTERNET, EQUIPMENT, AND DIGITAL LITERACY IN AFFORDABLE HOUSING. NHC CONTINUES TO EDUCATE AROUND THE FEDERAL BUDGET WITH NHC'S BUDGET FORUM AND ITS ANNUAL JUNE POLICY SYMPOSIUM, WHICH DREW MORE THAN 200 PARTICIPANTS TO DISCUSS ISSUES OF HOUSING AS A PLATFORM AND LOW-INCOME HOMEOWNERSHIP.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: RAISING NATIONAL AWARENESS: NHC STRIVES TO BUILD NATIONAL AWARENESS OF THE IMPORTANCE OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND HOW IT RELATES TO THE HEALTH, EDUCATIONAL OUTCOMES, STABILITY AND OVERALL ECONOMIC VIABILITY OF OUR COMMUNITIES; AND TO BROADEN THE CONSTITUENCY BASE OF THOSE INVOLVED IN AFFORDABLE HOUSING.NHC IS PRESENT AT THE STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL WHERE HOUSING PRACTITIONERS, COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS, RESEARCHERS AND PROGRAM MANAGERS COME TOGETHER TO DISCUSS THE HOUSING ISSUES AND OPPORTUNITIES IN THAT REGION. NHC HOSTED A CONVENING ON HOUSING COMMUNICATIONS IN SEATTLE, WA WITH JUST UNDER 100 ATTENDEES AND A RESTORING NEIGHBORHOODS POLICY CONVENING IN NEW ORLEANS, WITH ABOUT 180 ATTENDEES. BOTH CONVENINGS ALSO HAD SESSIONS OFFERED VIA WEBCAST TO REACH A LARGER NATIONAL AUDIENCE. STAFF PRESENTED AT MEETINGS AND STATEWIDE CONFERENCES IN 21 STATES AND HOSTED EIGHT WEBINARS ON RELEVANT HOUSING RESEARCH AND POLICY ISSUES REACHING OVER 1200 PEOPLE NATIONWIDE. NHC PUBLISHES THE WASHINGTON WIRE, A WEEKLY LEGISLATIVE BULLETIN, AND UNDER ONE ROOF, A MONTHLY NEWSLETTER, REACHING OVER 1500 SUBSCRIBERS. THE CONFERENCE ALSO IS WORKING TO DEVELOP HOUSING PROFESSIONALS THROUGH ITS HOUSING COMMUNICATIONS NETWORK AND YOUNG LEADERS IN AFFORDABLE HOUSING GROUP.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: RESEARCH: NHC'S RESEARCH DIVISION PRODUCES EVIDENCE-BASED RESEARCH ON THE HOUSING AFFORDABILITY CHALLENGES OF WORKING FAMILIES AND INTERSECTIONS BETWEEN HOUSING AND OTHER SOCIAL POLICY ISSUES. IN 2015 NHC PUBLISHED FOURTEEN RESEARCH PUBLICATIONS AND HOSTED FIVE WEBINARS. THESE PRODUCTS COMBINED WITH NHC'S ONLINE TOOLS AND RESEARCH STAFF SPEAKING AT PUBLIC EVENTS, NHC SHOWCASES PROVEN AND PROMISING SOLUTIONS TO THE HOUSING CHALLENGES FACING AMERICAN HOUSEHOLDS AND COMMUNITIES.UPDATED ANNUALLY, NHC'S SIGNATURE PUBLICATIONS HOUSING LANDSCAPE AND PAYCHECK TO PAYCHECK, AN ONLINE DATABASE, FOCUS ON THE ISSUES OF HOUSING AFFORDABILITY AND THE SHARE OF A HOUSEHOLD'S INCOME SPENT ON HOUSING AND WAGES VERSUS THE COSTS OF HOUSING. BOTH OFFER DATA AT THE STATE AND LOCAL LEVEL FOR USE BY LOCAL OFFICIALS AND PRACTITIONERS.NHC HAS ALSO PRODUCED BRIEFS THAT EXAMINE THE POSITIVE IMPACT AFFORDABLE HOUSING HAS ON THE HEALTH OF CHILDREN AND ADULTS. NHC'S PUBLICATIONS OFFER EXPLANATIONS OF HOW HEALTH CARE REFORMS ARE CREATING NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR CROSS SECTOR COLLABORATION BETWEEN PRACTITIONERS IN THE HOUSING AND HEALTH FIELDS. NHC'S RESEARCH IN INCLUSIONARY HOUSING POLICIES INCLUDES SHARING STRATEGIES FOR DEVELOPING FLEXIBLE INCLUSIONARY HOUSING POLICIES THAT PROVIDES MODELS FOR PUBLIC OFFICIALS CONSIDERING INCLUSIONARY POLICIES TO INCREASE AFFORDABLE HOUSING IN THEIR LOCALITY. IN 2015 NHC LAUNCHED INCLUSIVEPOLICY.ORG, AN INCLUSIVE COMMUNITIES ONLINE TOOLKIT.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: DUE FROM CENTER FOR HOUSING POLICY

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES THAT A TAX POSITION BE RECOGNIZED OR DERECOGNIZED BASED ON A "MORE-LIKELY-THANK-NOT" THRESHOLD. THIS APPLIES TO POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT BELIEVE THEIR CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INCLUDE, OR REFLECT, ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: MEMBERSHIP SHALL BE OPEN TO ALL INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT THE MISSION OF THE CONFERENCE. THE CLASSES OF MEMBERS AND THE LEVELS OF SUPPORT SHALL BE DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS. MEMBERS OF THE TRUSTEES, INDIVIDUALLY AND AS A GROUP, SHALL ACTIVELY SUPPORT AND PROMOTE THE CONFERENCE AND ADVOCATE FOR ITS MISSION. MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ARE EXPECTED TO PARTICIPATE IN CONFERENCE EVENTS AND TO ENCOURAGE OTHERS TO BECOME MEMBERS OF THE CONFERENCE AND SUPPORT ITS MISSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: ALL MEMBERS IN GOOD STANDING ELECT THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONFERENCE'S BYLAWS. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES ELECTS THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS, THE GOVERNING BODY FOR THE CONFERENCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NHC'S FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FEDERAL FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING. ADDITIONALLY THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS RECEIVES A COPY OF THE FEDERAL FORM 990 FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE POLICY APPLIES TO ELECTED AND EX OFFICIO POSITIONS (BOARD OF TRUSTEES, BOARD OF GOVERNORS, EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, AND OFFICERS) AND STAFF. IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF EACH COVERED PERSON TO UNDERSTAND THE POLICY AND DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS THAT MAY ARISE. ELECTED AND EX-OFFICIO LEADERS ARE TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS TO THE CHAIRMAN. THE STAFF REPORTS ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS TO THE PRESIDENT AND CEO. AFTER DISCLOSURE, THOSE LEADERS WITH CONFLICTS WOULD REFRAIN FROM VOTING, OR BEING PRESENT FOR A VOTE. IN THE EVENT THAT AN EMPLOYEE HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, THE PRESIDENT AND CEO IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SURE THE BUSINESS IS COMPLETED IN THE BEST INTEREST OF NHC WITHOUT SUBSTANTIAL INVOLVEMENT OF THE EMPLOYEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN 2012, AN EXECUTIVE SEARCH FIRM WAS HIRED TO MANAGE THE SEARCH PROCESS FOR A NEW PRESIDENT AND CEO. THE COMPENSATION WAS DETERMINED THROUGH DISCUSSION WITH THE SEARCH COMMITTEE WITH GUIDANCE FROM THE SEARCH FIRM USING COMPARABLE SALARY DATA. EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION DID NOT CHANGE UNTIL 2015 WHEN THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS APPROVED A COST-OF-LIVING INCREASE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXPLANATION: ANYONE WHO CONTACTS THE CONFERENCE MAY REQUEST A COPY OF THE GOVERNING OR FINANCIAL DOCUMENTS. CONTACT INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ON THE CONFERENCE'S WEBSITE. THE FEDERAL FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE EACH YEAR ON THE WEBSITE WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG FOR NO CHARGE.

EXPLANATION: LIFE TRUSTEES ARE ELDER MEMBERS OF THE CONFERENCE RECOGNIZED FOR THEIR OUTSTANDING SERVICE TO THE CONFERENCE AND CONTRIBUTIONS TO HOUSING. THEY SERVE AS EX OFFICIO, NOT ELECTED, MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS. SOME LIFE TRUSTEES HAVE CHOSEN NOT TO, OR ARE UNABLE TO, PARTICIPATE IN MEETINGS.
TRANSFER OF 2015 NET INCOME FROM CHP (EIN: 23-7055367) 580.
THE AUDIT COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
